title: Rami Malek does the heavy lifting as he carries two big bags alongside Lucy Boynton
text:
Rami Malek seemed to be doing the heavy lifting as he left a hotel in New York City on Thursday.

The Bohemian Rhapsody actor was carrying two big bags over his shoulder as an umbrella handler made sure he did not get wet.

Also seen was his girlfriend Lucy Boynton, 25, who wore a black-on-black outfit that included a Leo T-shirt by Givenchy, a short black skirt and a cardigan.

On-the-go: Rami Malek, 38, donned a white sweater, black straight-leg jeans and lace-up combat boots as he left a hotel in NYC on Thursday

She finished her look off with patent leather Mary-Jane shoes with three buckles.

Rami, 38, donned a white sweater, black straight-leg jeans and lace-up combat boots.

He carried a vinyl duffel bag over his shoulder as he navigated the pavement.

The sighting comes as Rami admitted he kissed his No Time to Die costar Daniel Craig during rehearsals for the new Bond movie.

Chic: Lucy, 25, wore a black-on-black outfit that included a Leo tee by Givenchy, a short black skirt and a cardigan

Posh: She finished her look off with patent leather Mary-Jane shoes with three buckles

When the Mr. Robot star appeared on The Late Show With Stephen Colbert, he dished the details on the moment.

Suave: The sighting comes as Rami admitted that he and his No Time to Die costar Daniel Craig planted a kiss on him during rehearsals for the new Bond movie

'He grabbed me and picked me up. I can’t tell who initiated the next moment, if it was him or I, but a kiss transpired between the two of us,' he said.

'I’m going to say that Daniel initiated it … I took a moment, caught my breath, and said, "Does that make me a Bond girl?"'

When asked if he had welcomed the peck, Rami replied: 'Very much so.'

Information about Rami's character is for the most part being kept mum, but it is known that he's playing the film's lead villain.

He wanted to confirm that his character had no religious intentions before accepting the part.

'It’s a great character and I’m very excited. But that was one thing that I discussed with Cary,' he said.

'I said, "We cannot identify him with any act of terrorism reflecting an ideology or a religion. That’s not something I would entertain, so if that is why I am your choice then you can count me out,"' Rami explained to Digital Spy.

No Time to Die will hit theaters everywhere on April 8, 2020.
description: They've been dating since last year. And Rami Malek and Lucy Boynton still looked to be going strong on Thursday as they were seen leaving the same hotel.
